resources.string: Certificates of incorrect Electoral Roll additions
Certificate of incorrect Electoral Roll corrections
2- For additions to the electoral roll
A.- For additions to the electoral roll
No. Voters at the Polling Station who have voted (3)
Number of voters registered at the polling station who voted
B) Non-registered polling officers who have voted
No. Polling officers not registered at the Polling Station who have voted (3)
Number of polling officers not registered at the polling station who voted
Total voters (Registered voters who have voted + Non-registered polling officers who have voted) must be greater than 0
Registered voters must be equal to Certificate of Electoral Roll Additions %s
Voters in Election must not exceed the electoral roll
Non-registered polling officers who have voted must not exceed twice the number of candidates standing (%d)
Total Votes Cast must be equal to Total Valid Votes + Rejected Votes + Disputed Votes
Votes for Candidates must be equal to Valid Votes
Votes for Candidates may not be greater than: (Total Voters - Blank - Informal) * No. Cand. in Constituency
Votes for a Candidate must be less than or equal to: Total Voters - Blank - Informal
Total voters (Registered voters who have voted + Non-registered polling officers who have voted) must be greater than or equal to Blank Votes + Informal Votes
Total Votes Cast must be equal to the Number of Voters in Polling station (%s)

Help: The Representative can press this button on each
creen and a help window will appear where
all the options and buttons are explained.

Battery: Shows the level of battery charge. It must
always be above 30%:
   Battery level very high
   Battery level high.
   Battery level medium.
   Battery level low.
   Battery level very low. Connect to the network.
   Flat battery. Connect to the network.

Coverage: Shows the level of coverage:
   Very High.
   High.
   Medium.
   Low.
   None: You must contact the Polling Station
  Service Centre.

Level of Coverage: Shows the level and type of coverage.
It could be one of the following:
   High.
   Medium.
   Low.
   None
  Operator (Movistar, NO SIM o NO NETWORK) and type of
  coverage (HP, H, 3G, E).

Click in the "polling station code"
to fill from the corresponding data to the current phase at the selected polling station

Constitution of Polling Stations:

For the constitution of a polling station, the following must be indicated:

  - Check Digit of the Polling Station: You must enter the number that appears in
     the Check Digit field of the report.
  - Number of voters (domestic and foreign) according to the electoral rolls:
     You must remind the returning officer of the need to update the
     electoral roll data of domestic voters and overseas voters with the
     Appendices of Additions and Removals if they have been received. (Enter up to
     four digits in each field).

After entering the number of voters in each election, click the button to send the data indicated.
If sent successfully, this will be reported on screen. If any errors are detected in the data entered, an error message will appear on the screen for correction

Constitution of Polling Stations:

For the constitution of a polling station, the following must be indicated:

  - Check Digit of the Polling Station: You must enter the number that appears in
     the Check Digit field of the report.
After entering the check digit, press the button to send the data indicated.
If sent successfully, this will be reported on screen. If any errors are detected in the data entered, an error message will appear on the screen for correction.

Constitution of Polling Stations:

For the constitution of a polling station, the following must be indicated:

  - Check Digit of the Polling Station: You must enter the number that
     appears in the Check Digit field of the report.
  -Number of domestic voters according to the electoral rolls:
     You must remind the returning officer of the need to update the
     data on electoral roll of national voters with the
     Appendices of Additions and Removals if they have been received.
     (Enter up to four digits in each field).

After entering the number of voters in each election, click the button to send the data indicated.
.If sent successfully, this will be reported on screen. If any errors are detected in the data entered, an error message will appear on the screen for correction.

Data: Indicates data coverage:
   Connected: Data coverage
   should be monitored, so that the polling station is in connection to the
    server at all times.
   Not connected: You must contact the Polling Station
   Service Centre.
Please check that the personal data of the Transmitter, stored in the device, are correct

Data for the Polling Place and assigned polling stations:

According to the data on the polling station entered in the previous screen,
the data for the Polling Place and the polling stations assigned to the representative:
Displays the location of the Polling Place on the map.
   If the data are correct, press this button to confirm the Polling Place and continue.
   If the data are not correct, pressing this button will return
to the screen where polling station data were entered and they can be modified.

School St. Mary's School 
 P.O Box 40580 
 Nairobi City, Kenia

Information on connection data:: Using this button
we obtain the following information about the connection
data. The Polling Station User Service Centre can
request authorisation to consult these data in case of an incident:

  - Mode: Self-training, test run or election day.
  - Operator running the network to which the device is
     connecting. If it is not MOVISTAR
     you must contact the Polling Station User
     Service Centre.
  - APN you are connecting the device.
  - IMEI: Device ID.
  - ICCID: ID SIM card ID.
  - Polling Station IP.
  - Server IP.
  - Failed Connections.
  - Software Version.
  - Data Version.
  - Query the last status: Pressing this button
     displays information that may be useful in certain
     cases for the Polling Station User Service Centre.

Entry of data from one of the tables assigned to the representative::

Once the Representative has been identified, the data entry section will
appear from one of the polling stations they have assigned. The required data to be :

  - Province: Province code (Two digits).
  - Town/City: Town/City code (Three digits).
  - District Code: District code(two digits).
  - Section: Section code(Three digits).
  - Polling station: Polling station code (one letter).

After entering all the details of the polling station, press this button to continue

 Next, press this button to find the polling station you have entered:
If all the data are correct, you will be taken to the next screen to confirm the Polling Place and polling stations. Otherwise, a message will appear below the field that needs to be modified.

 By pressing this button ALL data entered will be deleted.

 At any time you can modify the personal data of the Polling Place from the Menu, by selecting the configuration option.

During the test run and on Election Day you will need to call the polling station User Service Centre to modify the data of the Polling Place.

Screen navigation modes:
Selecting and entering data on the polling stations assigned to each of the
elections in its current phase can be done in two ways:
-Press on the name of the election you want to select and it will be
 highlighted.
-Swipe the pointer/finger across the centre of the screen, to the right
  or to the left, until the Election
  tab you want to select is highlighted.

Details of Representative:

When the device is started for the first time, the personal
details of the Representative will be requested. They are:
  - Document: Press the button    to enable the Foreigner\'s Identification Number option
     if applicable
  - NIF / NIE: Number and letter of the National ID / Foreigner\'s ID Numer.
  - Name and surname(s): Enter the name and surname(s) of the representative.
  - Telephone 1:First contact telephone number. This must be a mobile phone on which.
     it is possible to contact the Representative at all times, especially
     during the Test Run on Election Day
  - Telephone 2: Second contact phone (optional).

It is important that these details are correct, since they will be used in the event of
having to contact the Representative.
 After entering all the personal details, press this key to continue.

Personal details of the Representative::

 Once all the details are entered, press this button:
    If all the details are correct the Polling Place tab is activated. 
    Otherwise, a message will appear below the field that needs to be
    modified.
 Pressing this button means ALL the data entered will be deleted. 
 At any time you can modify the personal data from  
by selecting the configuration option.

Ways to enter the data on the screen::
To move and edit the fields there are four possibilities:
  1-Clicking on the field to edit.
  2-Clicking on the pencil, to the right of the field you want to edit
      at this time will be changed to the   check box indicating thet the data
      in that field can be modified.
  3-Clicking the next key on the keyboard will allow you to move from one field
      to the next
  4-Upon completion the field will automatically jump to the next one, except for
      the field “Name and surname(s)”, in which it will be necessary to perform
      any of the above options.

Ways to enter the data on the screen::
To move and edit the fields there are four possibilities:
  1-Clicking on the field to edit.
  2-Clicking on the pencil, to the right of the field you want to edit
      at this time will be changed to   check box indicating that the data
      in that field can be modified.
  3-Clicking the next key on the keyboard will allow you to move from one filed
      to the next.
  4-Upon completion the field will automatically jump to the next one.

Election Tab:
The application displays as many tabs as elections needing to be
transmitted. Until the data are sent from the polling station for
the highest-priority election in the current phase, this polling station will not be
vailable to complete its data for the rest of the applicable elections.

Device Data:These are the identifying data of the polling station:

  - APN: through which the device is connected..
  - IMEI: Device ID
  - ICCID: SIM card ID..
  - Device IP.
  - Server IP.
  - noR connection: Indicates the number of connections without response.

Polling Place Details:  The data which are recorded on the device.

  - Polling Place: Name of the Polling Place.
  - Address: Street, number, town/city and postcode
  - Reference Polling Station: One of the polling stations assigned to the representative.
  - List os polling stations: Other polling stations assigned to the representative.

Vote counting: Basic concepts

  - Electoral roll: This is the number of people eligible to
     vote and who have not been deprived, permanently or temporarily, of the
     right to vote.
  - Certificates of Additions: The number of voters who have submitted a
     specific electoral roll certificate issued by the Electoral Census Office
     that enables you to enforce the right to vote at that polling station.
  - Voters registered at the polling station who have voted: Indicate the number of
    voters included in the electoral roll for the polling station.
  - Non-registered polling officers who have voted at that polling station:  Indicates the number of
     polling officers who have voted and are not on the electoral roll of the polling station.
  - Number of invalid votes: The following are considered invalid votes:
        · Those issued in envelopes or ballot slips other than the official model
        · Ballot papers without an envelope.
        · Those issued in altered envelopes.
        · The ballot papers in which the           names of the candidates have been
          modified, added, or blacked out, the order of placement changed,
          or those in which any legend or expression has been introduced,
          or any voluntary or intentional alteration been produced.
        · The envelopes containing more than one ballot paper for different candidates
          (if several ballot papers from the same candidate are included, it is counted
          as a single valid vote).
        · Remember: Those ballot papers are not invalid on which some sign or
          mark has been made that does not generate any doubts about the
          intention of the vote.
  - Number of blank votes: Indicate the number of envelopes that do not contain
    a ballot paper.

Fields of vote counting report

First, to perform the vote counting, the following information needs to be
indicated:

  - Check Digit of the polling station: You must enter the number that appears
         in the Check Digit field in the report.
  - The following data from the printed report:
        · On additions to the electoral roll..
        · Registered voters who have voted..
        · Polling officers not registered at the polling station who have voted..
        · Number of invalid votes..
        · Number of blank ballots..

Subsequently, the data of the votes for each candidate are filled in. No
need to fill in for those candidates who have received 0 votes.

Validations: Remember that the number of registered voters at the polling station who have
voted (A) + Polling officers not registered at the polling station who have voted (B) must
be equal to the sum of votes for candidates + blank votes + invalid votes.
Number of voters on the electoral roll at the polling station who have voted (A) must be less than
or equal to the sum of the electoral roll + certificates of additions.

Display of data entered into counting screen::
ou can display the full vote counting screen, after finishing entry of data from the vote counting report, for this you need to click on the icon that closes the data field that has been expanded .
To scroll around the entire vote counting screen, you will have to slide the pointer or your finger on the screen and move vertically.

Entering data on the vote counting screen::
To enter data in the fields of the vote counting screen, you must first write the. Check Digit. Then you need to:
 1) Click on the field where you want to enter the data, it will expand and
     the keyboard will appear at the bottom of the screen.
 2) Enter the value corresponding to the data field that is visible on the
     screen and press the key .
 3) Enter the appropriate value for the next expanded field.
     You must repeat points 1, 2 and 3 as many times as necessary until you
     complete the data in all the fields of the vote counting screen
     (report data and votes for candidates) as they are given in the report.

When the value of a field is zero, you do not need to enter this number, you can press the key and move to the next field or click in the field you want to fill.
To move and view the extended data fields you can also use the pointer, sliding vertically up the screen to the data field you want to select.
You can display the full vote counting screen on finish entering the data from the vote counting report, for this you need to click on the icon that closes the data field that has expanded .
To scroll on the full vote counting screen, you need to slide the pointer or your finger vertically on the screen.

In the current phase, no action is required
by the representative. The change to the phase of
constitution of the polling station will be automatic.

Status of the polling stations:

This screen displays information about the status of each of the polling stations
in the different phases of the electoral process (The column of the current phase is highlighted in a different colour).

The different states of a polling station in each phase can be:
   No data:There are no data from the polling station.
   In submission queue:The data from the polling station are waiting to be sent.
   Sent by polling station:The data from the polling station have been sent by polling station.
   Sent by telephone: Sent by telephone: The data from the polling station have been sent by
        telephone.

Status of the polling stations:

This screen displays information about the status of each of the polling stations
in the different phases of the electoral process (the logo will be highlighted).
The column of the current phase is highlighted in a different colour.

The different states of a polling station in each phase can be:
  No data:There are no data from the polling station.
   In submission queue:The data from the polling station are waiting to be sent
   Sent by polling station: The data from the polling station have been sent by device.
   Sent by telephone:  The data from the polling station have been sent by
        telephone.
Has been introduced the whole polling station data for that phase

This phase indicates that all data have been sent
by polling stations assigned to the representative.

Location of the Election:
Indicates the province to which
the saved Polling Place belongs.

Enter details of one of their polling stations assigned to transmit on election day. The data (Province, Town/City, District, Section and Polling Station) can be found in the reports that were delivered with the device

No Data:
Indicates the number of polling stations for which the data
for the current phase have not been entered.
Not Sent:
Indicates the number of polling stations where data have been entered
for the current phase, but are in the submission queue.

Mode: Indicates the mode in which the polling station is operating:
   Self-training.
   Exam.
   Test Run.
   Election Day.

Operator running the network to which
cthe device is connecting (HP, H, 3G, E). If it is not
MOVISTAR or NO SIM or NO NETWORK is shown,
you must contact Polling Station Support Center
.

Other options::

  - Personal data: Edit the personal data
     of Representative.
  - Query status..
  - Screen: Accessibility and brightness.
  - Turn off the device.
  - Start Exam.
  - Make call.

Main Screen: Reference polling station, address and data of the Polling Place.

Clicking on the reference polling station , data for the polling
place and assigned polling stations will be displayed:
  - Address of the Polling Place: Polling Place and its address..
  - Polling Stations at the Polling Place: List of assigned polling stations and their electoral roll.

The View Map button displays a map with the physical location of the
polling place.
The Edit button will display the polling station editing screen (except during
Test Run and Election Day). If the Representative needs to correct these data
they need to contact the polling station User Service Centre.

To hide these data, simply click again on the reference
polling station .

Main Screen: Data Sender.

This section reports on the number of polling stations that do not yet have data
and the number of the Polling Stations still unsent.

Status of the polling stations:

    Clicking on the Status of Polling Stations , button will display
    Status of the Polling Stations, screen, where we can see the status for each of the polling stations and phases
    on Election Day. The Status of the Polling Stations can be:
        No data .
        In submission queue.
        Sent.

Stations without data:

    Clicking on desired electoral process , displays a list of the
    polling stations that do not yet have data for the electoral process and
    current phase(indicated in the title on the screen).

    Clicking on any of the polling stations that appear in the list, we access
    he screen of the corresponding phase, where the check
    digit of the polling station and other data to indicate at this stage will be
    shown. This process is repeated for all the polling stations

    To hide this list of polling stations without data, simply click again
    on the electoral process .

Options button:

See the latest status: pressing this button
will display information that may be requested
by the Polling Station User Service Centre.

Display: by clicking this option you can enable
or disable accessibility (possibility of
increasing the size of the screen) and adjust the
brightness.

Start exam: this option provides access
to the exam and must only be chosen when
indicated by the trainer.

First Advance:

To send data for the First Advance, you need to indicate:

  - Check Digit of the polling station: You must enter the number thatappears in the Check
     Digit field of the Report.
  - Number of voters at the polling station in each Election: Enter up to four digits
     in each field.

After entering the number of voters in each Election, click the button to send the data indicated. If sent successfully, this will be reported on screen

If any errors are detected in the data entered and error message will appear on the screen for correction.

Validations:Remember that the number of voters in the First Advance must be less than or equal to the electoral roll for the polling station in that Election.

Second Advance:

To send data for the Second Advance, you need to indicate:

  - Check Digit of the polling station: You must enter the number that appears in the check digit
     Controlof the report.
  - Number of voters at the polling station in each Election: Enter up to
     four digits in each field.

After entering the number of voters in each Election, click the button to send the data indicated. If sent successfully, this will be reported on screen.

If any errors are detected in the data entered, an error message will appear on the screen for correction.

Validations: Remember that the number of voters in the Second Advance must be greater than or equal to the First Advance of the Election selected and less than or equal to the electoral roll for the polling station in that Election.

Configuration:
 Selecting this option we can view or modify,
personal data or assigned polling stations. The same as
f the button is pressed

Data Sender::
 Clicking on this option will display
the main screen of the current phase.

Status of Polling Stations:
 Pressing will display the screen
where you can see the status of
each polling station in each of the
phases of Election Day.

Telephone:
 Pressing this button will display information on the device User
Service Centre and the keyboard to make a call

Telephone:

After dialing the telephone number of the polling station User Service Centre,
will appear on the bottom of the keyboard button to activate/deactivate the handsfree
and the bar to regulate the volume.

Phases: Election day is
divided into the following phases:
 - Prior to Election Day.
 - Constitution of Polling Stations from
 8:00 p.m.
 - First Advance (*)
 - Second Advance (*)
 - Vote Counting: 8:00 p.m.
 - End of Election Day.
(*) The device user must transmit
the information corresponding to the
progress according to the schedule indicated in
the polling station user manual and
according to the selected Election.

SW version:
This information may be requested from the
Polling station Support Centre.

Return:  Button to return
to the previous screen.

Click on the button\"OK\", so the Polling Place will be registered in the System
